Description: Floor fragment of a North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; outside plain and ribbed; inside, black-figure decoration: sphinx and a swan in an antithetical position, both in black with added red and incised details on white slip.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 224, no. 113)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 108, pl. XXXIV, no. 319.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.802)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5730 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
